column2: grandma ann, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Diabetic & heart disease leaves my options limited, severe neuropathy in left ft,blood clots & blockage, stints in thigh which helped tons,still have numbness,pain,ect... you get the picture, oh also numbness in hands, finally made it to my second pod. looking for answers for my feet & he gives me samples of Metanx & tells me its a B vitamin but that it helps with nerve damage & problems of neuropathy didnt say anything about side effects & I couldnt read tiny print insert, took it anyway didnt expect much but glad I took it, have only taken a couple of weeks & was tempted to stop because of a shooting pain in R-leg near ankle that had the vein taken out for bypass felt like an electric shock for about 1-2 weeks then stopped,must have been resetting my circuits:-) anyway all my pain & problems got better, tried to fill Rx on last day of samples only to find that Medicaid doesn't pay, going to check out Neuropath B that another reviewer noted, I have no income at this time due to disability & I am desperate to be able to walk & wear normal closed in shoes again. I had hoped that with longer use that all my symptons would go away or be even better and just not taking it for last couple of days my problems are back full force. I have not experienced any ill effects that a few reviewers noted, all in all i think this stuff is pretty good. would like the chance to give it a longer try.

column9: I was prescribed this product for numbness in my toes.  I had already experienced a couple of Papules on my heels.  After my 3rd dose, I awoke with extreme swelling of my arms and feet, so I discontinued and notified my Dr. who Poo-poo'd the reaction!  For the next week, I could hardly walk, as the pain was like a severe bruise on the entire bottoms of my feet.  Now, two weeks later, I'm having an outbreak of Papules on my heel.  I already had a couple, but these are numerous and painful.  I am now wrapping my heels with tape, keeping them iced, and elevated, to little improvement.  I'm afraid to see the same Dr. after his response to my reaction!  Has anyone else reported such cases?

column2: Metanx, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My primary care physician in treating my diabetes (diabetic neuropathy), have me on Lyrica, Glyburide, 325 aspirin p/d, while my Endocrinologist has me on Metformin, and within the last month wrote out a prescription for Metanx.  I talked to my pharmacist who told me the Metanx would be $40 per month for twice a day prescription, while the generic, Neuropath-B would only be $5 per month.  She called my endocrinologist to see if she would settle for the generic . . . she did.  In the short period of less than a month, my numbnes, burning feeling in my lower legs and tingling of feet has decreased.  I will write anothe report in 6 months.  I also take Alpha Lipoic Double Strength R Fraction, Folic Acid, and Reversatrol 100 with no problems.   Sidewind45

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had an ankle replacement 6 months ago; tibia was broken during surgery and tibial nerve suffered damage.  I was experiencing severe numbness in the entire bottom of my foot and severe nerve pain from where tibial break was down thru the bottom of my foot and out the ends of my toes.  Was very uncomfortable. Metanx was suggested to me; taken daily.  Have been on this med for 6 weeks.  Experienced nausea and headaches for about 4 weeks.  Both have subsided now.  I have noticed a remarkable difference in the discomfort with my left foot since taking this drug. Still have the nerve pain, but it is highly tolerable.  Med didn't affect the numbness. The biggest thing I noticed was an increase in my overall daily stamina.  I now have no side effects and will continue taking this medicine.  Hope this information is helpful.

fred3204, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: About a year ago, I was diagnose with golfer's elbow. Had injections several times; didn't help. Was referred to my Orthopedic Doctor to see what he thought. He said that within 6 to 9 months I would lose 50% use of my (R) Arm; and that in one year, I wouldn't have use of it at all. He sent me to see my Neurologist to have EMG done. It showed that I had already suffered some damage to my elbow. With his recommendation of surgery, I went ahead with it;noting that it does have risks. He did recommend that I do take Metanx before the surgery and continue taking it after until further notice. To this date, I have no complaints because it has help aide in the recovery of the surgery.

column9: Taking for Diabetic Neuropathy.  Almost immediately developed ear problems similar to Tullio's phenomenon: sensitivity to loud noises and clicking tinnitus in one ear.  After these symptoms eased I resumed Matanex and symptoms immediately resumed.  Doesn't add up, but guess I'm off Metanx for good.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
tri girl tri, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am a 41 year old female triathlete that ended up with medial calcanial nerve numbness in one foot due to ill fitted cycling shoes. As a result I have an inflamed Planar, calf and achillies tendon and am taking an NSAID for the inflamation and using a splint to stretch my planar muscle. I have only been on the vitamin a short time but so far I am already noticing a benefit from it. The numbness in my heel is quickly reducing and hopefully I will regain full nerve involvement now that the root issue has been diagnosed (the cycling shoes) and the course of treatment is aggressively addressed. I am back to running and cycling will be a lot better once I am able to find a properly fitted pair of triathlon shoes for future races. I also have a C5-C7 fusion in my neck and suffered nerve damage in my left radial nerve extensions in my hand that are exacerbated by sitting in one position too long... especially when I am in aero position for long periods of time. Since starting metanx I have had no recurrence of that nerve numbness as well and I was completely flopped on the couch tonight which usually sends me looking for advil for the impending headache from such lazy posture.So with this good of results... I may be taking this the rest of my life. Good thing it only costs me a co-pay but would be well worth paying out of pocket for it. As with anything I think it is well within reason to do a lot of reading and map your reactions to this and any other medications but I hope it works for you as well as it has for me.

column2: kocomo7, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was skeptic about this working.  It works!  I have been taking Metanx for 3 years. I have had no negative side effects. I stopped taking it once, thinking it wasn't really making that much difference, but I was extremely wrong!  I had forgotten how bad my previous symptoms were. It was given to me by a podiatrist to help with the stinging effects that I have with Fibromyalgia.  I've had Fibro since 1984, before the doctors had a diagnosis for all those symptoms!  I was first diagnosed with MS (by an MRI).  Thank God the doctors were wrong.  The Fibro is hard to deal with at times but much better than dealing with MS.  The Metanx really has STOPPED the stinging symptoms.  Happy to at least loose one symptom 99% of the time.  I have never had the blood test but will do so next time I have blood work done.  I was also low on Vitamin D (by blood test) and taking Vitamin D has made a difference in the Fibro.  Magnesium has seemed to help with sleep problems.  Hope this helps someone.  I almost cry these days when I see the Fibro commercials on TV.  It took so long for the general public to know about and understand what we go through.  I almost cry because I am relieved that someone else won't be told it is all in their head or will be ignored by a doctor who just doesn't have a clue!  Try the Metanx for the stinging - I pray it works for you too!

column2: Annie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Have taken Metanx for about three years since I began seeing a new internist. Was taking Foltx before.  I began experiencing  swelling of legs and ankles and possible yeast-type infections on upper trunk that secreted a bloody fluid with a strong, offensive odor. MD has ignored complaints. Symptoms increased and underclothing was regularly soiled and stained by the secretions. A couple of months ago I began alternately omitting certain meds and discovered that the yeast-type rash, secretions and foul odor were much less when I had intermittantly discontinued Metanx. When I ceased using Metanx completely, the rash, odor and secretions also ceased. I am inclined to think that those symptoms may have been caused by the Metanx.  The swelling in my legs and ankles has diminished also. I need to address this with my internist for change of medication.  I was under the impression that Metanx was just a vitamin.  No one ever mentioned it was intended to treat neuropathy and related problems. If that is what it is intended for, I am puzzled.  I have serious cramps that settle in my shins and awaken me from sleep at times. I also have cramping in my hands and feet related to chilling temperatures that distort their appearance and use. I believed the leg cramps were caused by a back injury and bulging discs of many years duration.  Whatever, the medical profession needs to sort out these symptoms and medications to effect improvement in my qualify of life. I do not believe Metanx is the correct medication for me.
I DO NOT KNOW WHY I AM TAKING THIS DRUG - MY VASCULAR SURGEON PRESCRIBED ITVLD

column2: Freddd, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Metanx was excellent in most all ways.  The only failing was that I did not get enough methylcoblamin to restore feeling to my feet.  I need to inject 30mg daily in 3 or 4 doses of methylcobalamin to restore feeling and control to my lower legs and feet.  The Metafolin is incredibly more effective than folic acid for me and my lifelong chelitis went away within days.  I don't have FMS or CFS any more, my blood pressure dropped 50 points, my CRP dropped to <1, no more asthma, no more hay fever, no more chemical sensitivity, my lifelong depression lifted, I have energy, no more nausea, no more headaches, no more neuropathic pain, no more muscle pains.  I'm a whole new person.

column2: Scared, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My neurologist prescribed this medication for my numbness and tingling in my hands, legs, and feet. I started taking it for about a day or two. Then, decided to do a little research. I am a little scared to continue this medicine because of some of the reviews that I have read. I have Rosacea, so I do not want to experience the flushed face. I have heard that there is a little swelling with this medication as well. I cannot afford to gain any more weight. In addition, I do not want heartburn or gas. I know that some people will have these symptoms and some may not. I am a little scared to continue because I do not want to end up experiencing any of these. The other reviews were positive, but with my luck, I may end up one of the few, that will have the side effects that I am fearful of. The best thing is to sit down with your doctor and/or pharmacist and make sure this is something for you. I think that I will discontinue this medication and talk with my neurologist about taking something else.

column2: Candice157, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was having increasing numbness in my legs and feet. I thought it was due to a compressed disk. The numbess was finally keeping me from getting good night's sleep, so I went back to my neurologist. He did some nerve conduction tests AND did some blood work (because I also was experiencing extreme tiredness/exhaustion that I could not attribute to the sleep interruptions).I was not diabetic, I was not anemic and my thyroid was performing normally. My B12 was very, very low. He place me on 2 Metanx per day (1st year I took only 1 and built myself up to 2). The numbness is very much reduced. My 2 little toes on my left foot have stopped curling inward. My energy level has increased and I can now get my home chores done on the weekend without feeling I need to take an extra day off from work, just to rest up. Once I got adjusted to the Metanx (which created some hyperness at first), I got back to exercising daily (because I finally had some energy). I'm so happy that this has helped me. I tell everyone to have their B12 levels checked! Candice
